website_summaries.verdict: Panasonic Lumix G Leica DG Macro-Elmarit 45mm F2.8 ASPH. is a macro lens for the Micro Four Thirds system, but it doesn't get really sharp until you narrow its aperture.

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile macro/portrait lens.
customer_reviews.text: For me, I think I get better (sharper) portraits than reviews have led me to believe. I bought it because it was a great deal at $500 and it doubles as a true macro lens. If you want both on an m43, I recommend this lens. This can still even be squeezed indoors for some general use whereas the Olympus 60mm macro almost completely loses that capability. I know the Oly has more visual guides on the lens itself, but aside from that I think the Panny is more versatile while still providing sharp images.
customer_reviews.author: Omar C.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful macro lens.
customer_reviews.text: This is quite simply just a wonderful macro lens. It's expensive, but you can find it used or grey market for less. It has the most beautiful rendering; sharp, great colors, but not gritty looking. One of my very most favorite M43 lenses of all.
customer_reviews.author: jalywol18

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Canon 65mp-e macro as well as the Canon 100mm L macro. I like this lens better than both of those! It's sharp and combined with the GH3, focuses fast and is very sharp. I'm sorry I waited so long to pull the plug on this.
customer_reviews.author: 5D Mike

customer_reviews.title: really fast focus and getting great depth of field from it
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous lens...really fast focus and getting great depth of field from it. I am having a week nderful time learning how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A., Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to buy this lens?
customer_reviews.text: I waited to buy this lens because of the price, and even spent $70 on a Raynor close-up lens instead, but this lens is worth the money. The autofocus is fast in the macro range, and I've been very pleased with my macro shots. What I wasn't expecting is how much I'm using the lens for non-macro work. It's fast and compact, and it's on my camera a lot. If you want a good macro for a μ4/3, you really can't go wrong with this lens. It takes advantage of the benefits of μ4/3, like size and image stabilization. I'm very glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: KR_reads

customer_reviews.title: Nice, solidly built lens
customer_reviews.text: Using on a Lumix G5. No autofocus issues (as others have reported), yet. Nice, solidly built lens.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect companion to my Leica 25mm F/1.4. It excels in all situations, even in low light. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: gardelix

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fast Macro Lens
customer_reviews.text: I recently converted my setup from a Canon DSLR to the Lumix 4/3 Micro system. This 45m Macro (90mm Equiv) is even better then my Canon 100mm Macro which was a fantastic lens. Buying it used from KEH (In like new condition) made it even better as I saved $300 over brand new. KEH is a great reseller of used camera gear in great condition at great prices!
customer_reviews.author: FON

customer_reviews.title: Met my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and the picture results were fabulous. Took it to Costa Rica, so many amazing shots. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: D. Bernath

customer_reviews.title: The is the lens to have: portrait and macro all in one
customer_reviews.text: This lens is amazing because of two simple reasons: 1) it have a very close focus distance for macro shots and the AF speed is very fast 2) it is optically equal and likely better than the Olympus 45f1.8 as a portrait lens The best 45mm on m43 platform, period.
customer_reviews.author: NCHammer

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: I needed a macro lense and also a faster short telephoto. I already have the 45-200 but it's max aperture is f4. This is 2.8 and much more useable. It works well on my G3 and my OMD m5. I like it who can't like Lica glass.
customer_reviews.author: A Gottschald

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: There is just some sort of crispness in the images from the Leica heritage that reminds me of Leicas I have used previously. Also gives excellent results for macros although in a low contrast situation I did find some problems with the auto focus picking up the background rather than the, admittedly small, object I was trying to photograph in the foreground.
customer_reviews.author: Becassine6

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Lens
customer_reviews.text: Completely happy with this baby:-) Sharp,fast and good build. A solid investment.I've recently been using it to do a roster of memembers of our Church. Shooting in 1:1 format close up and getting fine pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Old Jim

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic - Leica Macro Lens
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful! What a lens! If you are a micro four thirds photographer, this lens will give you such beautiful images. Price at Amazon is discounted. I'll leave all the technical reviews to others and just say that this lens will make you a happy photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin L. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Great lens but...
customer_reviews.text: Lens arrived on time and well packed. My only complaint is the minimum focusing distance is not that close. Image quality is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Gates

customer_reviews.title: This is Fun
customer_reviews.text: I have shocked myself with what wonderful images I have produced. I've upload some of my images to Amazon. It's nice. The micro 4/3 system lets me access great lens at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Diji

customer_reviews.title: Truly amazing lens
customer_reviews.text: A truly amazing lens. No need to repeat all others reviews......here. Buy this lens, you will not be regret for sure! I am using the Olympus E-P2, just love it with this lens and the Panasonic 20mm f1.7 lens too.... I will not be going back to DSLR!
customer_reviews.author: Midwestsupport

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Leica Macro lens
customer_reviews.text: It is heavier and better built than other non-Leica Panasonic lens. The focusing range is 0.5 ft to infinity. The macro photos taken with this lens are very good. Considering the cost of the lens, it might not be wise to buy it if one only takes occasional macro shots.
customer_reviews.author: Made Birdie!

customer_reviews.title: Brutally honest
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, read the other 5 star reviews here. Brings up true colors. In portraiture the lens is brutally honest. One can see every tiny blue vein through a layer of makeup and skin break ups 2 days before you can see them with a naked eye. Has almost X-ray vision, apparently designed by vampires...
customer_reviews.author: BookWorm

customer_reviews.title: Leica... AMAZINGLY GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: This lens is beyond amazing. I've been a photographer for 50 years, and I would go so far as to say this is the best lens I've ever shot with!
customer_reviews.author: ThinkmanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful close ups`
customer_reviews.text: Within a month I drop it once & it broke. The photo's quality is very nice!
customer_reviews.author: rick brown

customer_reviews.title: Must have lens for GF2
customer_reviews.text: Paired with the GF2 it's an amazing tool. Great macro lens. Clean and sharp images. Beautiful depth of field.
customer_reviews.author: JDM

customer_reviews.title: Just a wonderful Portrait Lense
customer_reviews.text: I haven't yet had the opportunity to use this lense for its intended purpose, i.e. macro photography, but I have used it as a portrait lense, and it is very very good. The last time I used such a lense was when I had my old Minolta XE7 with a 90mm Rokkor shooting 200ASA Ektachrome. My present combination of Lumix GF1 and Leica/Lumix 45mm is so much smaller and lighter and makes it easier to take tack-sharp, rich and contrasty head and shoulder portraits. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard D'Lima

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Not as sharp at greater distances as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Harry S.

customer_reviews.title: Must have lens for MFT
customer_reviews.text: I love my Panasonic GF!. This is an incredible lens for MFT. Sharp as hell. Great macro as well as portrait. If you have MFT you should have this lens.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Sengul

customer_reviews.title: Leica-Panasocic 45mm 2.8 lens
customer_reviews.text: I have used this lens for some portraits and a few macro pictures. it is sharp and I have had good results. The only problem I have had is an occasional problem with the auto focus when using it for macro pictures. On occasion it would focus on the background instead of my subject. This is probably a camera problem or a user problem instead of a lens problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: An excellent lens
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's supposed to do, take macro images. In retrospect I would have liked a little longer range of focus. The lens is sharp and solid. I haven't used it for a portrait shoot yet so I'll see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: William Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic/Leica need to redesign this lens
customer_reviews.text: The good news is it has a 45mm focal length (90mm equiv). The bad new is it is the second oldest lens in the lineup and it shows it. The autofocus is slow, it hunts and it misses focus. A macro lens should be tack sharp and contrasty, this lens is not sharp at all, is not contrasty, All in all the 30mm macro is a better lens but if you need more reach I now use Olympus 60mm macro
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Review after 5 years of ownership
customer_reviews.text: This is about a perfect macro lens. I have been using this for 5 years to take both hand held macro photos and for portraits. The images have been great, colors very pleasing, focus speed and accuracy good (not great), while the lens has been 100% reliable despite not being weatherproof. If the lens breaks tomorrow I will buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: subpar quality/reliability of AF motor in this lens
customer_reviews.text: keywords: AF issue, AF broken, AF does not work, not focusing, autofocus does not work, autofocus broken, autofocus issue, panasonic issue, panasonic issues, panasonic does not work, af motor, autofocus motor, motor dead, motor broken, motor issue --- this lens has a design flaw where its AF motor dies, you might get "lucky" and it will die during the warranty period or not and it will die 18-24 month later... so the lens might be OK optically, but if you value your money please do not waste them on this lens or you are just taking chances
customer_reviews.author: DP

product_meta.title: PANASONIC LUMIX G LEICA DG MACRO-ELMAR LENS, 45MM, F2.8 ASPH, PROFESSIONAL MIRRORLESS MICRO FOUR THIRDS, MEGA OPTICAL I.S, H-ES045 (USA BLACK)
product_meta.description: The Panasonic 45mm F/2.8 (35mm camera equivalent: 90mm) macro lens with built-in image Stabilizer lets you take close-ups that capture your subjects in their actual size. It also greatly boosts mobility by serving as a medium-length telephoto lens for portraits, telephoto snapshots and landscapes.
feature_bullets: 45mm focal length; equivalent to 90mm on a 35mm film Camera
Uses both an aspherical lens and an ED Lens comprised of fourteen lenses arranged in ten groups
Inner focus motor system makes action smooth and silent when capturing still and video content
Minimum focus Distance can instantly be changed to 150mm or 500mm
Used with Lumix g micro system cameras, allows for use of the advanced contrast auto focus (AF) system

specifications.Included Components: Front & Lens Caps - Lens Hood - Lens Storage
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars40 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
